name: Build for Better Tomorrow
description:
Submission for Katana Jam II Game Jam made by Team "Just Fine" - Theme: "Wait, are we the bad guys?"

SETUP:

  • Download the .zip folder on your computer
  • Extract the files on your computer. 
  • Double click on HexGridTestTemp.exe to start the game.
  • The game CAN ONLY BE PLAYED in hotseat mode by 2 players. Either by sharing one gamepad, one mouse or 2 gamepads.

GAME OVERVIEW:

In this game, the Players are taking roles of huge global corporations which battle each other to develop the most glorious city, with a lot of urban and industrial development which will secure the human kind a long and better life. Of course, by doing so they will have to destroy the beautiful surrounding nature and eventually cast out any living animals that use it as a habitat. So, at the end we must ask ourselves the question: “Wait, are we the bad guys?” 

The game is played in 6 rounds. Each player will have a total of 18 dice, which represents their corporation wealth and power, during the course of the game. They will use 3 dice, that will be determined randomly, each turn.  There are 24 random generated Dice placement fields on the map and in groups from 1 to 4, 6 premade dice placement fields form 1 to 6 on the centre Map Tile and 6 premade dice placement fields form 1 to 6 outside the Map for a total of 36 placement fields.

The Players will score points when they take control of the map tiles on the board and during the final scoring after the 6 rounds are over. The Player with the highest number of points will win the game.

QUICK RULES:

  • At the start of every round, the players can use special powers - Swap Dice or Rerolls.
  • After the Special Power phase of the round, the players proceed to deploying their dice.
  • At first, the players must deploy their first die on the edges of the map - hex tiles only with 1 die slot.
  • On subsequent turns, the players must deploy their dice on hexes adjacent to other hexes that they already have presence on.
  • After one hex is filled - all die slots are filled - the hex is scored and will count later for the scoring of the player.
    • Ties are won by the last player placed die on the hex
  • When all hexes on the board are filled - the game ends and scoring will happen.

KNOWN ISSUES:

  • There's a chance the player could be blocked from making valid action during his turn. If that occurs, the players must restart the game.
